comments.body: Not entirely sure about it, but `await for` might be appropriate here ([example](https://github.com/flutter/cocoon/blob/master/app/bin/dev_server.dart#L97)). It should track subscriptions for you and cancel them automatically when errors happen.
That would prevent the async work from happening in parallel, unless I misunderstand where you want the await.
I think it can be used inside `findCostsForFile` for iterating over lines and on this line. But you are right, if we use it to iterate over files, it will prevent parallelism across files.
i'll just stick to the current pattern here, so it's consistent
In addition to this, tests could also be marked as skipped with the `@Skip` annotation: https://pub.dartlang.org/packages/test#skipping-tests

Interesting.

We don't seem to use this yet... let's just not use it. :-D

We may want to be able to whitelist entries.  e.g.

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/980c8a737b7ed211cc86fcf6a84538e71f5c6c25/dev/tools/gen_date_localizations.dart#L83
That's the entry that made me add this, actually. I plan to remove it.
